poem:
Title: "Upon the Scandal Tainted Vein"

This dire ink, in veins exposed,
Blight's currency exchanged, imposed.
Hear victim's pleas from sterile halls,
For loose-lipped justice that enthralls.

The state's remorse, yet stagnant, caged,
In politico's rhetoric staged.
Compensation's song rings raw, deceived,
Hope's payment in bureaucracy relieved.

No changes immediate – his speech,
To those who suffer, justice leach...
Yet, in silent pain, theirs the cost,
In life's dear currency, forever lost.
